page.title: 06THE FARMER'S YEAR
page.content: {Kilhendre}is a family owned farm of 300 acres of grassland,barley and oats with 120 dairy cows,300 sheep and 500 pigs. Here is a typical{year of the {farmer: {JAN.}Lambing,manure spreading. {FEB.}Lambing,ploughing,fencing. {MAR.}Tilling,sowing barley,cows out. {APR.}Inject cows,sow rye grass. {MAY.}Spray corn,drench sheep. {JUN.}Shear/dip sheep,gather silage. {JUL.}Cut docks and thistles. {AUG.}Combine corn,sow rape seeds. {SEP.}Hedge brushing,buy ewes. {OCT.}Check machines,clean ditches. {NOV.}General repairs,cows inside. {DEC.}Make new fences. {Daily duties}include milking,feeding animals and cleaning them out. Farmers need to{get up early,work long {hours,}have lots of{patience}and{not {get downherted}when things go wrong.
